intro: Tetracarpum anthemoideum, commonly known as the common tetracarpum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its slender, herbaceous stems and small, yellowish flower heads that resemble dandelions. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. Its leaves are alternate, linear to lanceolate, and often have a slightly rough texture. Tetracarpum anthemoideum is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and is often found in temperate regions across Europe and parts of Asia.
